reviews.review_msg: Very good passionate professor, easy to talk to and always offers help. Good option if you are serious and want connections in the field
best prof in KPU. u better take his class

Josh is hands down the most caring, engaging, and fair professor. His students are his priority. He always makes time for them, and he works hard to keep his material interesting and engaging. Hes smart and definitely has a wealth of knowledge. Id recommend his courses to anyone!!
Josh was an amazing instructor. The class had some really excellent guest speakers and I learned a ton. He really knows his stuff. Would definitely take again!

He marks so hard and his final exam is just ridiculous. All written and you dont know what to expect. Studied a lot for his final it was worth 30% but when its all written you forget details. Only if he wouldnt have a cumulative final. If youre good with memorizing then take him otherwise avoid.
Josh is great prof would recommend taking him
enjoyable lectures, funny and very likable. 3 hour lectures go by pretty fast. (definitely eye candy)
best prof ever

Josh's class was one of the best classes I've taken at SFU. His lectures are highly interesting and he really cares about the material he is presenting. The exams are fair and not as tough as I thought they would be. You do need to read the textbook though.
Mostly guest lectures.
Excellent prof. I absolutely loved his class.

Josh is an amazing instructor. One of the best Ive had at SFU so far. His lectures are really engrossing and he brings in some interesting guest speakers. If you put in the work, youll get a good grade. And youll learn a lot. I definitely recommend taking a class with Josh.

Best prof I have had in 3 years at SFU. Engaging lectures, interesting stories as well. Makes you want to go to lecture. Textbook is necessary because he doesn't write a lot on his slides. Exams are fair and he gives good reviews on what to focus on! 100% would recommend, even for an elective.
Josh is the best prof, he makes the class enjoyable and his lectures arent boring and hes eye candy so i mean bonus lol
Best prof I've had so far. Really interesting lectures which don't just restate the textbook, with some great stories. Exams are based mainly off of the textbook and marking is fair.

Josh is one of the best profs I've had at Kwantlen. He keeps the class engaged and genuinely cares about the subject matter. I would recommend taking a course with him as opposed to another prof, I will definitely retake another course with him!

Josh was an amazing professor and is a very kind, caring and understanding individual. He has helped me so much this semester in making sure I knew what was happening during class, offered extra help and postponed an exam for me because I wasn't ready. Funny, talkative and knowledgeable, he is great.
If you're reading this, take him The best professor there is!!!!

Josh is truly the best professor I have had at SFU. Not only is he knowledgeable in his field, but he also has no trouble relating to his students. He goes above and beyond to make classes enjoyable, yet educational. Although he sets the bar high, he marks fairly and gives excellent feedback. I wish more profs were like Josh!
Josh is laid-back and a great lecturer.  I took this class as an elective and loved it.  His exams are super easy but do require a fair amount of studying.
great prof

very passionate and knowledgeable about the material, cares for the students, engaging lecturer, funny and tells interesting stories. he's extremely approachable and down to earth. final was the same length as the midterm and exams are straight from the notes. id love to take another class with him.  one of my fav profs at SFU for sure.

Josh is very passionate about criminology! His lectures are solid, although sometimes he rushes lecture and draws the last two slides for 30mins. Exams are based off of his review notes. Fairly straight forward, and a great lecturer!
I took Crim 104 with Josh and I really enjoyed it. Hi lectures are awesome and he really makes some pretty boring topics really interesting. Would love to take another class with him.
Take a class with Josh and you will not be disappointed. A great experience.

Be prepared to read! Exams are strictly based from the textbook and tutorial readings! Tutorial readings are a must to pass this course. Josh is a great lecturer, very straightforward & funny but he barely gives lectures. Most lectures consist of guest speakers. As long as you do the assigned readings, the class will be fine
Amazing class!

LOVED Josh's classes. His passion for the subject matter rubs off on his students, and he is always available for extra help on papers, etc. He's a tough marker, but he's fair. Discussion in these classes were some of the best I've had in 6 years of attendance at SFU. I took 351 based on how awesome 251 with him was and was delighted. A fresh take.
Came to Yerchich's Intro class to give a lecture on policing. Murphy's great; interesting and lively. Def gonna try to get a class with him.

Josh is a great prof, his experience with policing definitely shows so he is extremely knowledgable about what he teaches. He has some great stories too. Lots of reading and tests are kind of tough, but fair (no trick questions) if you  know your stuff. Brings lots of guests speakers in. Make sure you read and attend class.

Josh is amazing. He cares for his students, no BS kind of guy. Great lecturer! Make sure you read the textbook for the tests, tends to go through his lecture notes rather fast.   He is a bit of a hard marker, but not to bad, easy to make a B+

Probably one of the best profs at SFU! Josh is engaging and his lectures are always interesting and funny. Has a great deal of knowledge of policing issues and isn't worried to tell his perspective. Would definitely take another class with Josh. Be ready to participate in class.
One of the best prof's I've had at SFU. Hands down.
Expects students to be keeners and memorize 90% of textbook and lecture material. Assigns 12 lengthy articles that are all testable.

Josh is a nice and passionate prof. Unfortunately, textbook and tutorial readings are heavily biased in favour of the police. Midterm and final are based mainly on memorizing textbook material and key points from weekly tutorial articles.

Exams mostly based off textbook, few MC lecture question, and some written/MC tutorial questions. His lectures are based off the textbook mostly, make sure to cross reference to find the lecture specific info because it will be on the exam. Overall wonderful lecturer, very engaging and passionate.

Josh is great!! Such an entertaining and friendly person. Uses lots of his own storiespersonal experience to illustrate concepts during lecture. Go to his office hours if you don't understand something, he's always super helpful and willing to help. The guest speakers were amazing as well. I would definitely take another course taught by him.

Josh's lectures are interesting if policing is your thing. Lots of guest speakers make up most of the lecture periods and are extremely valuable for information which can appear on exams, but are also good for inspiration and additional knowledge. Exams are tough - study everything! But overall, it's an easy course that can be fun and interesting.

Josh is an amazing prof, he actually knows his stuff and is enthusiastic about the subject. I would totally take another class with him. Although it was an 8:30 it was entertaining and everyone stayed awake lol, unlike any other class Ive had at that time.

Josh is an excellent professor. His midterm consisted of all the basic stuff you should have studied. His final was definitely different and focused more on the specifics. He does mark hard on the term paper but then again he did say you can go to him for help on editing! Josh loves to give out participation marks in tutorial- great for shy people.

Great prof, very knowledgeable and passionate. He is very down to earth and easy to approach. Would highly recommend taking courses with him. He is a bit of a tough marker but the exams weren't too difficult.

It was his first time teaching. He was very kind and passionate about the topic. His lectures, however, are too long and poorly presented - reiteration of the textbookwrites down basically word-for-word on the PowerPoint what he's saying outloud. Tough marker - especially on the paper. I feel he would be a great prof with more experience.

It was his first time teaching the class, although he TA'd it for a while. He's a great guy, super enthusiastic about policing but hard ass marker. He expects his students to be over enthusiastic try-hards, and if you're not, your grades will reflect that.
loved it

I was very lucky to have a TA like Josh for my CRIM 251 class,  His tutorials were fun and he encourages students to take part and be involved in the discussion, very helpful when it comes to exam preparation, word of advice, u have josh as ur TA in any class, take advantage of his office hours, if u do u will get an A
Super funny and down to earth, makes the material fun. Encourages interaction and participation. Super cute too!
Great TA who is always willing to help and replies very quickly when you write him an email. Would take another class with him!
Josh is really knowledgeable and enthusiastic at what he does. He's friendly and funny as well. Really helpful and made tutorial enjoyable. Overall, an awesome TA!
Great TA, always willing to be helpful and goes beyond what is expected of him.
